Control.Name: CostumeCheckbox
Control.Tooltip: Automatically switch to the current costume slot?

Control.Text: Are you sure you want to replace the $SET set with your current equipment?
Control.Name: AreYouSureText

Control.Text: Are you sure you want to delete $SET?
Control.Name: AreYouSureText

Control.Text: Welcome to MrFancyPants 2.0! First, let me apologize for this screen. I wanted to ensure all MFP users read my explination for why your set data has been wiped. I needed to change the way I handled item identification and storage for a few reasons. 1: I can now identify items significantly more accurately. 2: I am now far better prepared for the EquipItem API coming from Carbine in a future update. 3: It will now be much easier for me to drop a few big features I have planned in as time allows. Second, I wanted to add this screen to point out a Carbine bug. You should only see this screen once - if you see it on every login Wildstar is failing to properly store the save data for this addon (and probably others). The most common reason I've identified for this is that the AddonSaveData folder is write protected by Windows. Please ensure full write permissions are allowed for the user you are running the game as. Finally, I want to say thank you to everyone who uses the addon and the kind words I've received since I started development. At the moment I don't have much play time at all (new puppy) so I'm trying to add features and squash bugs as quickly as I can. I wanted to get MFP ready for EquipItem and that means releasing a big, relatively untested update to the masses. If this goes poorly, sorry about that. If anyone can identify a situation where MrFancyPants is still confusing two similar (but not identical) items please let me know with a screen shot. If you could provide example items on Dominion-Caretaker-US that would be amazing (I'm level 35 on my highest). Happy Hunting! --- Kyle (DrVance - Caretaker)
Control.Name: Message
